result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A Perez Teron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.

Inform agent of all prescriptions. Inform any treating physician about this case. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Dated 04/04/17, from the DOC to Judge Carter, regarding the Defendant's probation sentence.

04/18/17,  per Judge Carter: Per letter and courts review, please prepare an amended JOC changing the probation term on count 3, to 2 years.  The term on count 1 remains unchanged.
Order revoking huber privileges.  Signed by Judge Carter on 03/27/17.
Dated 03/24/17, from Jail Administration requesting huber privileges be revoked for the balance of the Defendant's sentence.
Dated 03/17/17, from WCSD, advising that the Defendant reported to Huber on 03/17/17 at 12:45 pm to serve his 30 day sentence. Sentence was adjusted accordingly.
Associated with Charge #3

Dated 03/16/17, from the WCSD, advising that the Defendant did not report for his sentence as ordered.

No action taken as the Defendant later reported for his sentence.
Associated with Charge #3

Defendant Jose A Perez Teron in court with Attorney John Paul Marchan.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Marchan requests an adjournment as Defendant has a medical appointment today.  State objects.  Court denies request.  Case proceeds to sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Carmen M. makes statements.  Attorney Marchan makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS  -  transfer allowed to Milwaukee County -  CONCURRENT

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Let any treating physician know of this case
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
 

COUNT #3:  WITHHELD SENTENCE 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS   - Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County -  CONCURRENT

DL REVOCATION:  12 Months

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Let any treating physician know of this case
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel

FINE:  $1,179.00   (to be paid as a condition of probation) 

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 3/16/17 by 5:00 p.m.
